commit_list.message:
polymorphic belongs_to association with touch: true updates old record correctly

Example: Given you have a comments model with a polymorphic commentable
association (e.g. books and songs) with the touch option set.
Every time you update a comment its commentable should be touched.
This was working when you changed attributes on the comment or when you
moved the comment from one book to another. However, it was not working
when moving a comment from a book to a song. This is now fixed.

commit_list.message: Small wording fixes
commit_list.repo_description: Simple, efficient worker queue for Ruby & PostgreSQL.

commit_list.message:
Moved scheduling timestamp into its own column and created separate migrations

Since the release of 3.0.0 the created_at column is "out in the wild"
and probably being used to keep track of when a job was created. It
should not be used for something semantically completely different like
scheduling therefore I introduced a new column for that aspect.

commit_list.repo_description: Testing rails

commit_list.message:
Disabled debug log on production

The debug log is taking up a lot of disk space, so it is disabled in
production...
You can enable it for debugging by uncommenting the line in the config.
Merge branch 'logging'

Using request context instead of header to store state

Transferring state between handlers using headers was hacky and leaky
(the proxy backend could see the header as well).
Now a request context is used to transfer state between handlers.
Fixed typo
Logging SCM access keys for each query to a dedicated queries.log
Added nginx conf files for development and production
Project can be deployed with capistrano
Renamed built product to nginx-query-server-proxy
Supporting different NGINX_ENVs (like RAILS_ENVs)
Upgraded nginx to 1.7.11
Removed unnecessary debug output
Configuring gcc explicitly to use C99 standard
Moved test-related gems into test group

Refactoring: optimized mem usage

By not accessing the access key and signature from a copy of the
Authorization header but from ngx_str_ts pointing into the header
the copy of the header becomes unnecessary.

Also: more unit tests
Refactoring: fetching Authorization header only once
rake restart is more robust
Fixed interpolation of ngx_str_t
Integration test that checks auth rewrite against actual kooaba backend
Some additions and fixes to unit tests
rake task to run tests
Unit tests for Authorization header rewrite
More robust rake start/stop tasks
Refactoring: using more ngx_str_t instead of u_char*
Using ngx base64 encoding instead of (deprecated) openssl one
Fixed warnings
Refactoring: using ngx_sprintf to interpolate ngx strings more elegantly

Using nginx memory pools instead of memory from the heap

see http://netsecinfo.blogspot.ch/2009/12/pool-based-allocations-nginx.html
for more details
Explicitly enabling all warnings in dev build config
Initializing all pointers
Fixed typo: wrong var name
Refactoring: extracted create_request_signature method
Auth rewrite handler aborts early if there are no auth rewrite rules
Better/separate configure and build rake tasks
rake tasks to start/stop nginx
Auth rewrite handler is only invoked once per request
Authorization header is rewritten according to auth rewrite rules
Restructured code a bit
Auth rewrite rules can be set via config file
Basic project structure

New release (0.2.0)

CocoaPods instructions in README
Added podspec file
New release (0.1.0)
Fixed typo
Changelog in Xcode project
Merge branch 'offline_shortcut_generation'
Values for short link domains are checked to be valid domains
Added documentation on how to use custom short link domains
Documentation for offline short link generation
Removed some unused variations of methods
Offline generated short links can use custom domains
Short links can be generated offline (immediately on device)
Refactoring: extracted SCStringUtils
Implemented short URL generator corresponding to our Android implementation
Implemented number encoder corresponding to our Android implementation
SCConfig class is available after importing Shortcut.h
Better error message
Short link app store URLs can no longer be overridden
Renamed SCItem -> SCShortLink
Restricted visibility of no longer public headers (SCDeepLinking, SCEventTracking)
Removed no longer needed methods
Added launch time assertion to Shortcut class
Added change log
Fixed typo
Short migration guide for users of the old deep linking SDK
Fixed code identation in README
Documentation for the new interface
Renaming ShortcutDeepLinkiningSDK -> Shortcut
Simple, unified interface for all SDK functionality
Documented usage of event tracking feature
Basic event tracking: app installs and app opens
All constants are properly namespaced
Extracted first launch checker into separate class
New release

The createShortLinkWith...: methods invoke their completion handler on the same queue that they were invoked on

If you call any of these methods on the main queue then the completion
handler will also be executed on the main queue, if you call any of
these methods on a background queue then the completion handler will
also be invoked on the same background queue...
Embedding bitcode in compiled framework
New release
Fixed formatting
Documented usage of SDK with Universal Links
Deferred deep linking works with Universal Links
Fixed README regarding the obtaining of API keys/tokens
Nicer/simpler interface for creating Shortcuts
Added Windows Phone deep linking support
Fixed compiler warning
README improvements based on Herbert's feedback
New release
Merge branch 'deep_link_item_creation'
Added documentation about short link creation
Small doc fixes
More convenience methods for creating new short links
New short links can be created
API requests send auth token
Refactoring: extracted config object
Merge branch 'automatic_session_handling'
Refactored SCSession interface
Deep link sessions are automatically finished when the user leaves the app

Updated README: our backend is now ATS compliant

See also https://github.com/shortcutmedia/shortcut-service/issues/42
Fixed compiler warning
New release
Improved README
More API documentation
SCSession -firstLaunchLookupWithCompletionHandler: always calls completion handler
Added some logging

Device fingerprint: platform build number extracted from user agent

The build number that is readable through the sysctl library does not
match the "official" platform build number that is e.g. found in the
Settings app or the User-Agent string...

So we use the "official" build number from the User-Agent string since
this is what the server has available for matching fingerprints...
Fixed param names
Some more README feedback by Herbert
Added hint about ATS to README
Some README improvements by Herbert
Framework target builds a releaseable zip
First README draft
Xcode build target that builds a .framework release

Tracking whole deep link viewing sessions

The "closing" of a deep link is associated to the opening of it via a
session and is reported to the backend.
Logging for network requests
Device fingerprint contains device ID
Refactoring: extracted SCJSONRequest class
Refactoring: extracted SCLinkIDExtractor class
Updated project file for Xcode 7
Refactoring: extracted SCDeviceFingerprint class
A little more documentation
Using live server
Shortcut-added query params are removed from deep link URLs
First-open handling is really only done on first open
First-open lookup handles NSNull and empty string URI responses
Network operations happen in a background queue
All requests contain full fingerprint params
Most basic functionality implemented
Initial commit with basic project structure
Refactoring: show/hide help methods are symmetrical

Flash button shows flash state correctly

To change a button's image one has to call -setImage:forState: instead
of trying to manipulate the button's image view manually...

Concerns #2
Refactoring: split method
Refactoring: renaming method
Removed debug statement

QR code detection works reliably with hi-res cameras

The zxing QR code detector scales down its input image heavily
before detection, so hi-res input was scaled down by a large factor
becoming unrecognizable.
By submitting a properly scaled down version to the QR code detector
this works now better...

Concerns #1
Documented still image sample buffer output
Fixed link in README
Some README improvements
Added .gitignore
SDK: SDK is identified in the user agent for the result page view
SDK: added more unit tests
SDK: started adding some unit tests
Code cleanup: removed commented out code and unnecessary comments
Code cleanup: hiding implementation details
Proper zxing license links in docs
Item view controller never "underlaps" the status bar
SDK build script does not crash if appledoc is not installed
SDK build script renders docs
API response with no matching metadata is handled nicer
Code formatting: unified identation
Added MIT license for SDK

Merge branch 'master' into shortcut_sdk

Conflicts:
	ShortcutSDK/ShortcutSDK/Scanner/SCMCaptureSessionController.m
Scan line animation stops before scanner disappears
Scan lines use tint color
Fixed warnings and deleted commented out code
SDK bundle images are loaded correctly in iOS 6/7

Result web view is hidden until first result is loaded

A web view without loaded content has a strange intrinsic content size
and renders with some artifacts. So we just hide it until the first
request loaded successfully.
Fixed warning
Scanner shows status message when single image is not recognized
Scanner view hides navigation bar when shown
Changed class prefix from KSC to SCM for the SDK
Removed unnecessary/duplicated defines
All localized strings in the SDK have sensible defaults and can be overwritten in the app

Moved SDK in separate project

Following roughly the steps from
https://github.com/jverkoey/iOS-Framework#walkthrough

Fixed metadata title/subtitle extraction

Apple seems to have changed the -preferredLanguages format to contain
strings with language/country combos (e.g. "en-US") instead of just the
language (e.g. "en")...
Removed unused variable
README improvements: demo keys and Andoid version mentioned
Camera view: info button is always properly updated
Camera view: toggling flash mode does not hide help view

Scanner view: info button works like flash button

The info button now appears bright or dark depending on whether the
info screen is displayed or not. This way it works like the flash
button...

Refactoring: removed state variable

The capture mode is inferred from the current state instead of
saving it in a separate state flag...
Refactoring: removed unnecessary (re)setting of capture session mode

Simplified capture session preset selection

All current devices (3GS and newer) should be able to capture at
least 480p video and it does not make sense to capture at a higher
resolution than 720p if we scale down the image for recognition
anyways.

This also concerns #1 a bit
Renaming "secret key" -> "secret token" for consistency reasons
Added Xcode workspace file
Renamed constant
Item view: status bar does not autorotate in a wrong way
Fixed layouting of scanner preview on tall screens
Small refactoring
Fixed documentation
Code cleanup: modern property usage
Code cleanup: removed unnecessary internal method forward declarations
SDK: renaming barcode to QR code
SDK: renaming camera view controller to scanner view controller
Fixed some iOS6 button spacing and display issues
SDK: added Installation and Getting Started sections to readme
SDK readme and license are copied to the build folder when building the framework
Item view controller has navigation toolbar when looking at result page links
Item view controller can handle mail, phone and sms links
Code formatting: unified code block braces
Code formatting: unified pointer syntax

Mentioning zxing license in README and LICENSE files

This should be enough to satisfy zxing's licensing demands regarding
distribution as part of the SDK.
See http://www.apache.org/dev/licensing-howto.html and
https://github.com/zxing/zxing/wiki/License-Questions
Fixed copyright notices
SDK documentation

Merge branch 'master' into shortcut_sdk

Conflicts:
	Shortcut/Classes/Controllers/KSCLiveScanner.m
Fixed size of scanner preview
Scanner view behaves properly when rotated
Scanner view uses AutoLayout
Simplified structure of scanner view

Scanner delegate has optional methods (QR code recognition, Done button)

These optional methods also act as switch for the corresponding
features: i.e. if the delegate implements QR code related methods, then QR
code recognition is turned on or if the delegate implements a done
handler then the Done button is visible
Scanner delegate is called on main thread
SDK framework and bundle are copied correctly to project dir
Scanner handles authentication errors (and unknown errors) properly for recognition requests

polymorphic belongs_to association with touch: true updates old record correctly

Example: Given you have a comments model with a polymorphic commentable
association (e.g. books and songs) with the touch option set.
Every time you update a comment its commentable should be touched.
This was working when you changed attributes on the comment or when you
moved the comment from one book to another. However, it was not working
when moving a comment from a book to a song. This is now fixed.

cast json values on write to be consistent with reading from the db.

See also commit 5ac2341fab689344991b2a4817bd2bc8b3edac9d

cast json values on write to be consistent with reading from the db.

commit_list.message: History works better with unknown beacons
Selecting beacon only if it was the closest for some time
Changed data layout a bit
Simpler keeping track of loading status
Displaying website of closest beacon when in overlapping regions
Nicer web view
Refactored view controller handling
A new region's website will be displayed even if an old one is already displayed

Notification handling is more robust

no more duplicate notifications are being generated
Basic functionality: website is shown when entering a beacon region

Deprecation notice
New release

The createShortLinkWith...: methods invoke their completion handler on the same queue that they were invoked on

If you call any of these methods on the main queue then the completion
handler will also be executed on the main queue, if you call any of
these methods on a background queue then the completion handler will
also be invoked on the same background queue...
Embedding bitcode in compiled framework
New release
Fixed formatting
Documented usage of SDK with Universal Links
Deferred deep linking works with Universal Links
Fixed README regarding the obtaining of API keys/tokens
Nicer/simpler interface for creating Shortcuts
Added Windows Phone deep linking support
Fixed compiler warning
README improvements based on Herbert's feedback
New release
Merge branch 'deep_link_item_creation'
Added documentation about short link creation
Small doc fixes
More convenience methods for creating new short links
New short links can be created
API requests send auth token
Refactoring: extracted config object
Merge branch 'automatic_session_handling'
Refactored SCSession interface
Deep link sessions are automatically finished when the user leaves the app

Updated README: our backend is now ATS compliant

See also https://github.com/shortcutmedia/shortcut-service/issues/42
Fixed compiler warning
New release
Improved README
More API documentation
SCSession -firstLaunchLookupWithCompletionHandler: always calls completion handler
Added some logging

Device fingerprint: platform build number extracted from user agent

The build number that is readable through the sysctl library does not
match the "official" platform build number that is e.g. found in the
Settings app or the User-Agent string...

So we use the "official" build number from the User-Agent string since
this is what the server has available for matching fingerprints...
Fixed param names
Some more README feedback by Herbert
Added hint about ATS to README
Some README improvements by Herbert
Framework target builds a releaseable zip
First README draft
Xcode build target that builds a .framework release

Tracking whole deep link viewing sessions

The "closing" of a deep link is associated to the opening of it via a
session and is reported to the backend.
Logging for network requests
Device fingerprint contains device ID
Refactoring: extracted SCJSONRequest class
Refactoring: extracted SCLinkIDExtractor class
Updated project file for Xcode 7
Refactoring: extracted SCDeviceFingerprint class

Using live server
Shortcut-added query params are removed from deep link URLs
First-open handling is really only done on first open
First-open lookup handles NSNull and empty string URI responses
Network operations happen in a background queue
All requests contain full fingerprint params

repo_list.description: A universal interface to import email contacts from various providers including Yahoo, Gmail, Hotmail, AOL and Plaxo.
This gem provides a Mapquest based geocoder for the geokit gem.
A gem to make using gosu even easier.
Code documentation written as code! How novel and totally my idea!
This is a copy of the official Lisp TextMate Bundle enhanced with a few goodies (Command-R to run a script)

A community-driven framework for managing your zsh configuration. Includes optional plugins for various tools (rails, git, OSX, brew,...), over 40 terminal themes, and an auto-updating tool so that you can keep up with the latest improvements from the community.
Simple, efficient worker queue for Ruby & PostgreSQL.
Game written in Ruby for learning Ruby and artificial intelligence.
Price book functionality for running sales, role based, country based pricing etc...
Tree Run - A Suicidal Freeski Undertaking
Ruby implementation of the ICU (International Components for Unicode) that uses the Common Locale Data Repository to format dates, plurals, and more.
